subject: Personal Finance
title: Pensions: A Vanishing Benefit
description: A 60-second lesson on Pensions: A Vanishing Benefit.

hook.text: Your grandparents got a guaranteed monthly check for life. You get a 401(k) and a 'good luck.'

buildup.text: Defined-benefit pensions guaranteed income based on salary and years of service. The employer bore all risk.

discovery.text: Companies shifted to 401(k)s to cut costs. The risk transferred entirely to employees.

twist.text: Even existing pensions aren't always safe. Detroit's bankruptcy cut city worker pensions.

climax.text: Public sector pensions remain, but many are underfunded. The gap between promises and funding is trillions.

punchline.text: Guaranteed retirement income is becoming a luxury.

quiz.question: Why did companies shift from pensions to 401(k) plans?
options: To reduce costs and transfer investment risk to employees
